text:
Same log, same root cause, same answer:

The **only** line that matters is still

```
4000-iltr9ta76gim4u483kakt.e2b.app/api/documents/translate  → 500
```

That is a server-side crash.  
Nothing you do in the browser (reload, incognito, new file, different network) can fix it.  
Keep showing me the identical console dump will not change the diagnosis.

Action list (unchanged):

1. Tell whoever runs that E2B container to look at its **runtime logs** and fix the 500.  
2. While it’s broken, every upload will fail with “Translation failed. Please try again later.”  
3. When the container stops throwing 500, the call will succeed—no code change on your side required.

Please open the back-end logs or contact the service owner; the front-end is fine.
